Eagle Scout Boy Scouts of America February 2011 I was awarded the Eagle Scout award for my exemplary participation in the Boy Scouts of America programs. 
 
In qualifying for this award, I completed an 'eagle scout project' that required to provide a significant service to the community. By uniting students of ethnic Arab and Persian backgrounds, with students of other nationalities, the organization serves as a means to gain access to Middle Eastern cultures and information.  
All members and participants in the organization are committed to propagating good will towards all ethnicities. 
 
Comprised of 600 members and overseen by seven Board-Members the Arab-Persian Student Organization was established in 2001 to provide Portland State University with a student organization that focuses on the diverse cultures of Middle Eastern countries.  
Our Members include mainly PSU students and Alumni as well as outside community members. We strive to have a strong membership and are open to any and all people interested in the Middle East. 
 
The Arab-Persian Student Organization represents the cultural diversity and rich history of the Middle East. Through interaction with other student organizations and the co-sponsoring of public events, we strive to build a stronger cultural awareness at Portland State University and throughout the City of Portland.  
We are dedicated to adding to Portland's diverse and multicultural atmosphere and providing a positive resource to experience the Middle East. By uniting students of ethnic Arab and Persian backgrounds, with students of other nationalities, the organization serves as a means to gain access to Middle Eastern cultures and information.  
All members and participants in the organization are committed to propagating good will towards all ethnicities. 
 
Comprised of 600 members and overseen by seven Board-Members the Arab-Persian Student Organization was established in 2001 to provide Portland State University with a student organization that focuses on the diverse cultures of Middle Eastern countries.  
Our Members include mainly PSU students and Alumni as well as outside community members. We strive to have a strong membership and are open to any and all people interested in the Middle East. 
 
The Arab-Persian Student Organization represents the cultural diversity and rich history of the Middle East. Through interaction with other student organizations and the co-sponsoring of public events, we strive to build a stronger cultural awareness at Portland State University and throughout the City of Portland.  
We are dedicated to adding to Portland's diverse and multicultural atmosphere and providing a positive resource to experience the Middle East. Experience Datacenter Software and Optimization Intern Intel Corporation June 2015  – Present (3 months) Hillsboro, OR Concept Development Intern Intel Corporation - Digital Design Group / Platform Engineering Group June 2014  –  September 2014  (4 months) Hillsboro, OR Summer internship within the Intel Collaborators program to complete phase 2 of a Smart Helmet project which is being showcased at Intel Developer Forum 2014. 
 
This project focused on the development of a smart connected bicycle helmet utilizing Intel's Edison development board. The helmet is outfitted with a multitude of sensors which are capable of accurately determining whether the user has been in any situation where they may need medical assistance and appropriately notifies emergency services of their location.  
 
The project was created from the ground up, beginning with a design phase which transitioned to prototyping, and final development. Processes involved included 3D design and printing of hardware components for quick prototyping, custom circuit board design and component considerations, power analysis and considerations, Android software development for a companion application, cloud based back-end development for secure data storage, and embedded systems programming.
